verbose_text: According to the HLH-2004 revised guidelines, the diagnosis of HLH can be established either if a molecular diagnosis is performed or if the patient fulfills five of the eight following diagnostic criteria : fever, splenomegaly, cytopenias, hypertriglyceridemia and/or hypofibrinogenemia, hemophagocytosis, low or absent NK cell activity, high ferritin level, and increased soluble IL-2 receptor 2.
